articles.author: Zeenat Saberin
articles.title: India: Can Congress party under Rahul Gandhi defeat Modi?
articles.description: The party under its young leader Rahul Gandhi is projecting itself as the main challenger to PM Narendra Modi in 2019.

articles.title: Narendra Modi an instrument of corruption: Rahul Gandhi

articles.author: PTI
articles.title: Meghalaya polls: Sonia Gandhi, Manmohan Singh among Congress star campaigners
articles.description: Meghalaya is set to go to polls on February 27 and the results will be announced on March 3. The tenure of the current 60-member assembly ends on March 6.

articles.author: PAUL GABRIEL
articles.title: Rahul Gandhi’s visit may be controversial but significant
articles.description: KUALA LUMPUR: India’s Opposition leader Rahul Gandhi (pic) will take a break from the heated election campaign in Karnataka state to talk business here and woo the sizeable Indian diaspora.

articles.title: Unlike PM Modi, I love even those who dislike me: Rahul Gandhi in Singapore
articles.description: Congress president Rahul Gandhi, who is visiting Singapore, slammed Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said that his party would defeat the BJP in the next election.

articles.title: IUML to broad-base its presence

articles.description: As the Punjab National Bank scam continues to rock the Parliament, Rahul Gandhi will travel to Singapore on 8 and 9 March, while on 10 March he will visit Malaysia, according to reports. The post Rahul Gandhi to visit Singapore and Malaysia this week; will ad…

articles.title: Congress wants ballot papers back, rejects simultaneous polls
articles.description: In the backdrop of different groups expressing their concerns over the EVMs, the Congress political resolution said the poll panel has the constitutional mandate to ensure free and fair elections.

articles.author: IANS
articles.title: Rahul says India tired of BJP, Congress to seek allies to oust Modi in 2019
articles.description: At the Congress Plenary Session, Sonia Gandhi hit out at the BJP govt for being 'power drunk', 'arrogant', 'dictatorial'. She said Modi indulges in 'dramebaazi' to earn votes

articles.description: Rahul Gandhi also accused PM Modi of "failing" to fulfil the election promise of providing two crore jobs to youths in the country every year.

articles.title: Why did Rahul and Netanyahu not meet?

articles.title: Rahul Gandhi sounds 2019 election bugle, slams PM Modi: Top 10 developments
articles.description: Rahul Gandhi, at Congress plenary session, accused Narendra Modi of symbolising crony capitalism, and said India's poor continued to live in 'Modi maya'

articles.author: FMT Reporters
articles.title: Rahul Gandhi to meet Indians in Malaysia
articles.description: The Congress president is scheduled to have sessions with businessmen and others and attend a youth event in Brickfields on Saturday.

articles.author: Christophe Jaffrelot, Christophe Jaffrelot
articles.title: The Most Hindu Of Them All
articles.description: The recent contestation of Rahul Gandhi's religious identity highlights the challenge in India today to recover the secularism of Nehru and Gandhi, for whom the assertion of one's Hindu identity did not imply an anti-Muslim or anti-Christian attitude.
